meanings.definition: Consisting of many parts or elements
meanings.sent1: The polymeric structure of the toy allowed it to be easily assembled and disassembled.
meanings.sent2: The artist used polymeric materials to create a colorful and intricate sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The polymeric puzzle pieces seemed to magically fit together perfectly every time.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like polymeric strands, intertwining and forming complex patterns.
meanings.sent5: The polymeric nature of the ecosystem ensured a delicate balance between all its components.

meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a polymer or polymers
meanings.sent1: The polymeric properties of the plastic made it durable and flexible.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the polymeric structure of the new material to understand its properties.
meanings.sent3: The polymeric nature of the substance made it resistant to extreme temperatures.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline was a polymeric landscape of buildings reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The polymeric bonds between the atoms gave the material its unique strength.
